tool_description: Selects and configures appropriate RF propagation models based on frequency, environment, and distance requirements for accurate path loss prediction.

environment_type.description: Environment: free_space, rural, suburban, urban, dense_urban, indoor

max_distance_km.description: Maximum prediction distance in kilometers (0.01 to 200)

base_height_m.description: Base station antenna height in meters (1 to 1000)

mobile_height_m.description: Mobile/receiver antenna height in meters (0.5 to 50)

model_preference.description: Preferred model: auto, hata, cost231, walfish_ikegami, free_space, two_ray

error_messages: Invalid frequency: Frequency must be between 30 and 30000 MHz.
Invalid environment: Must be one of [free_space, rural, suburban, urban, dense_urban, indoor].
Invalid distance: Distance must be between 0.01 and 200 kilometers.
Invalid height: Base height (1-1000m) and mobile height (0.5-50m) out of range.
Model incompatible: Selected model not suitable for given frequency/environment combination.
Invalid model preference: Must be one of [auto, hata, cost231, walfish_ikegami, free_space, two_ray].
usage: Specify frequency, environment, distance range, and antenna heights. The tool automatically selects the most appropriate propagation model or uses your preferred model if compatible.

selected_model.description: Name of the selected propagation model

validity_range.description: Frequency and distance validity ranges for the model
